alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 6:19PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Franklin, southeastern Douglas and southeastern Osage Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 619 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Eudora to 3 miles south of Baldwin City to 3 miles south of Quenemo. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Lawrence, Ottawa, Baldwin City, Eudora, Wellsville, Centropolis, Pomona, Quenemo, Princeton, Pleasant Grove and Vinland. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 171 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
